result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Archie L Oatis

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency).  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Archie L Oatis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Archie L Oatis.  Attorney Kelly O'Neill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for doctor's report return. Defendant made a record. Parties do not contest Dr. Seipel's report, Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if defendant continues to receive appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. The proceedings are suspended. The defendant is committed on 10-27-2022 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment. Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed. Case continued for return of doctor's report to January 19, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Forthwith Order.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Archie L Oatis not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Return on Doctor's Report. Defense made a record. Court passed the case. Case recalled with ADA Ringersma.  Defendanr refuses to appear in Court. There being no challenges to the report from Dr. Seipel's by the State,   defense or defendant, the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  

The defendant is committed on 7-18-2022 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment.

Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  **  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 2, 2072 at 08:30 am.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Archie L Oatis in court via zoom, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.  Case set for Return on Doctor's Report. Public Defender's office unable to represent this defendant due to conflict. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning 10-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned, Branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Archie L Oatis not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Doctor's Report Return.  Defense counsel will accept appointment and request an adjournment to review report with client. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Archie L Oatis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Archie L Oatis in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
